## Presentation Pipeline — Layout Demo

This interactive demo shows how the **Presentation Pipeline (PPTX)** skill module automatically triggers 7 distinct PowerPoint layouts from structured QMD markup. The same source file produces both this HTML preview and a professionally styled `.pptx` file.

::: {.column-screen-inset}

```{=html}
<div id="slide-gallery" style="position:relative; width:100%; max-width:1280px; margin:0 auto;">
  <div style="position:relative; border:2px solid #2A3F55; border-radius:8px; box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(78,205,196,0.15); overflow:hidden; background:#0D1B2A;">
    <img id="slide-img" src="../../assets/demos/slides/slide-01.png" alt="Slide 1" style="width:100%; display:block;" />
    <div style="position:absolute; bottom:0; left:0; right:0; display:flex; justify-content:space-between; align-items:center; padding:8px 16px; background:rgba(13,27,42,0.85);">
      <button onclick="prevSlide()" style="background:none; border:1px solid #4ECDC4; color:#4ECDC4; padding:6px 18px; border-radius:4px; cursor:pointer; font-size:14px;">← Prev</button>
      <span id="slide-counter" style="color:#A8B2C1; font-size:14px;">1 / 11</span>
      <button onclick="nextSlide()" style="background:none; border:1px solid #4ECDC4; color:#4ECDC4; padding:6px 18px; border-radius:4px; cursor:pointer; font-size:14px;">Next →</button>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
<script>
let currentSlide = 1;
const totalSlides = 11;
function showSlide(n) {
  currentSlide = n;
  if (currentSlide < 1) currentSlide = totalSlides;
  if (currentSlide > totalSlides) currentSlide = 1;
  const num = String(currentSlide).padStart(2, '0');
  document.getElementById('slide-img').src = '../../assets/demos/slides/slide-' + num + '.png';
  document.getElementById('slide-img').alt = 'Slide ' + currentSlide;
  document.getElementById('slide-counter').textContent = currentSlide + ' / ' + totalSlides;
}
function prevSlide() { showSlide(currentSlide - 1); }
function nextSlide() { showSlide(currentSlide + 1); }
document.addEventListener('keydown', function(e) {
  if (e.key === 'ArrowLeft') prevSlide();
  if (e.key === 'ArrowRight') nextSlide();
});
</script>
```

:::

::: {.callout-tip}
## Navigation
Use ← → arrow keys or click the Prev / Next buttons to browse slides.
:::

### Layouts Demonstrated

| Slide | PowerPoint Layout | QMD Trigger |
|-------|-------------------|-------------|
| 1 | Title and Content | `## Heading` + bullet list |
| 2 | Two Content | `## Heading` + `:::: {.columns}` (text-only) |
| 3a | Comparison | `## Heading` + `:::: {.columns}` (text + image) |
| 3b | Comparison (image-text) | Left: image, Right: text list |
| 4a | Content with Caption | `## Heading` + text + image (no columns) |
| 4b | Title + Image | `## Heading` + image only (top-bottom) |
| 4c | Four Quadrants | Diagonal text/image symmetry |
| 5 | Blank (Background) | `## {background-image="..."}` + `&nbsp;` |
| 6 | Title + Background | `## Title {background-image="..."}` + text |
| 7 | Two Content | Summary — layout trigger rules |

### Template Design: Roadmap

The "Roadmap" template is inspired by modern SaaS dashboard aesthetics with **neon glow effects** using native PowerPoint `a:glow` XML:

- **Background**: Deep navy gradient `#0D1B2A` → `#1B2838`
- **Titles**: Coral `#FF6B6B` with neon glow
- **Column headers**: Gold `#E8A838`
- **Accent / Frames**: Teal `#4ECDC4` neon glow frames
- **Text**: Bright white `#F0F0F0`

Design principle: **lines or frames, never both** — line glow for single-content layouts, neon frames for multi-column layouts.
